intro: Nicotiana guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan tobacco plant, is a species native to Central America. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its large, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces alkaloids, including nicotine, which are concentrated in its leaves. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and scientific research.
